intro: Trianthema pentandrum, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a succulent shrub characterized by its fleshy, narrow leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, which is known for its adaptations to dry climates. Trianthema pentandrum is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
